citing_paper_authors: Or, Biran | Samuel, Brody | Noémie, Elhadad
raw_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn lexical simplification rules from the edit histories of Wikipedia Simple articles
clean_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn lexical simplification rules from the edit histories of Wikipedia Simple articles.

raw_text: (Yatskar et al., 2010) use an unsupervised learning method and meta data from the Simple English Wikipedia
clean_text: (Yatskar et al., 2010) use an unsupervised learning method and meta data from the Simple English Wikipedia.

raw_text: Simple English Wikipedia has been used before in simplicity analysis, as described in (Yatskar et al, 2010)
clean_text: Simple English Wikipedia has been used before in simplicity analysis, as described in (Yatskar et al, 2010).

citing_paper_authors: Oliver, Ferschke | Torsten, Zesch | Iryna, Gurevych
raw_text: Thesequence of article edits can be used as training data for data-driven NLP algorithms, such as vandalism detection (Chin et al, 2010), text summarization (Nelken and Yamangil, 2008), sentence compression (Yamangil and Nelken, 2008), unsupervised extraction of lexical simplifications (Yatskar et al, 2010), the expansion of textual entailment corpora (Zanzotto and Pennacchiotti, 2010), or assesing the trustworthiness of Wikipedia articles (Zeng et al, 2006)
clean_text: The sequence of article edits can be used as training data for data-driven NLP algorithms, such as vandalism detection (Chin et al, 2010), text summarization (Nelken and Yamangil, 2008), sentence compression (Yamangil and Nelken, 2008), unsupervised extraction of lexical simplifications (Yatskar et al, 2010), the expansion of textual entailment corpora (Zanzotto and Pennacchiotti, 2010), or assesing the trustworthiness of Wikipedia articles (Zeng et al, 2006).

raw_text: More recently, Yatskar et al (2010) explore data-driven methods to learn lexical simplifications from Wikipedia revision histories
clean_text: More recently, Yatskar et al (2010) explore data-driven methods to learn lexical simplifications from Wikipedia revision histories.

raw_text: In contrast to Yatskar et al (2010) and Zhuet al (2010), simplification operations (e.g., substitution or splitting) are not modeled explicitly; instead, we leave it up to our grammar extraction algorithm to learn appropriate rules that reflect the training data
clean_text: In contrast to Yatskar et al (2010) and Zhu et al (2010), simplification operations (e.g., substitution or splitting) are not modeled explicitly; instead, we leave it up to our grammar extraction algorithm to learn appropriate rules that reflect the training data.

raw_text: Indeed, Yatskar et al (2010) learn lexical simplifications without taking syntactic context into account
clean_text: Indeed, Yatskar et al (2010) learn lexical simplifications without taking syntactic context into account.

raw_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn a set of candidate phrase simplification rules based on edit changes identified in both Wikipedias revision histories, though they only provide a list of the top phrasal rules and do not utilize them in an end-to-end simplification system
clean_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn a set of candidate phrase simplification rules based on edit changes identified in both Wikipedias revision histories, though they only provide a list of the top phrasal rules and do not utilize them in an end-to-end simplification system.

raw_text: In particular Yatskar et al (2010) leverage the relations between Simple Wikipedia and English Wikipedia to extract simplification pairs
clean_text: In particular Yatskar et al (2010) leverage the relations between Simple Wikipedia and English Wikipedia to extract simplification pairs.

raw_text: Hedge detection was also used to understand scientific framing in debates over genetically-modified organisms in food (Choi et al, 2012) .Revisions on Wikipedia have been shown useful for various applications, including spelling correction (Zesch, 2012), sentence compression (Yamangil and Nelken, 2008), text simplification (Yatskar et al, 2010), paraphrasing (Max and Wisniewski, 2010), and textual entailment (Zanzottoand Pennacchiotti, 2010)
clean_text: Revisions on Wikipedia have been shown useful for various applications, including spelling correction (Zesch, 2012), sentence compression (Yamangil and Nelken, 2008), text simplification (Yatskar et al, 2010), paraphrasing (Max and Wisniewski, 2010), and textual entailment (Zanzottoand Pennacchiotti, 2010).

citing_paper_authors: Angelina, Ivanova | Elena, Cabrio | Bernardo, Magnini
raw_text: (Yatskar et al, 2010) focus on using edit histories in Simple English Wikipedia to extract lexical simplifications
clean_text: (Yatskar et al, 2010) focus on using edit histories in Simple English Wikipedia to extract lexical simplifications.

citing_paper_authors: Marta, Recasens | Cristian, Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil | Daniel, Jurafsky
raw_text: The Wikipediarevision history has been used for spelling correction, text summarization (Nelken and Yamangil, 2008), lexical simplification (Yatskar et al, 2010), paraphrasing (Max and Wisniewski, 2010), and textual entailment (Zanzotto and Pennacchiotti, 2010)
clean_text: The Wikipedia revision history has been used for spelling correction, text summarization (Nelken and Yamangil, 2008), lexical simplification (Yatskar et al, 2010), paraphrasing (Max and Wisniewski, 2010), and textual entailment (Zanzotto and Pennacchiotti, 2010).

citing_paper_authors: Sander, Wubben | Antal, van den Bosch | Emiel, Krahmer
raw_text: Another useful resource is the edit history of Simple Wikipedia, from which simplifications can be learned (Yatskar et al, 2010)
clean_text: Another useful resource is the edit history of Simple Wikipedia, from which simplifications can be learned (Yatskar et al, 2010).

raw_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn a set of candidate phrase simplification rules based on edits identified in the revision histories of both Simple English Wikipedia and English Wikipedia
clean_text: Yatskar et al (2010) learn a set of candidate phrase simplification rules based on edits identified in the revision histories of both Simple English Wikipedia and English Wikipedia.

raw_text: Woodsend and Lapata (2011) and Yatskar et al (2010) use Wikipedia comments to identify relevant edits for learning sentence simplification
clean_text: Woodsend and Lapata (2011) and Yatskar et al (2010) use Wikipedia comments to identify relevant edits for learning sentence simplification.
